issues.subject: Look into dataviz options
issues.description: For ws usage tables.

issues.subject: My Moderation Requests
issues.description: There should be a page where a topic owner can view/moderate all their requests.

issues.subject: Indicate topics where the user's subscription/posting will be moderated
issues.description: Would be useful to set expectations on what will happen when they submit a request.

issues.subject: Allow mailboxes to be browsed
issues.description: Should have a UI for looking at bounced/discarded messages.

issues.subject: OBSIP network request
issues.description:
By email: 
Submitted By: 	Kasey Aderhold (kasey@iris.edu)

Experiment Type:		Active
Experiment Fullname:		Alaska Langseth Experiment to Understand the megaThrust
Experiment Short/Nickname:	ALEUT
Experiment Description:		The aim of this program is to characterize the megathrust, overriding and downgoing plates, and other fault systems associated with the Alaska-Aleutian subduction zone from the Shumagin gap, across the Semidi segment, to the western end of the Kodiak asperity. To achieve this, we will use multichannel seismic (MCS) reflection and wide-angle reflection/refraction (WARR) data, and relate the reflection and velocity images to the mechanical behavior of the megathrust and other faults based on the history of subduction earthquakes [Davies et al., 1981], historical intraslab and crustal earthquake hypocenter distribution, present-day locking of the plate boundary from GPS data [Fournier and Freymueller, 2007], and other available constraints.

Principle Investigator(s):
Donna Shillington, LDEO, djs@ldeo.columbia.edu

Start Date:	2011-06-29
End Date:	2011-07-11

Network Code Type:	Both

Region of interest:
	Min Lat:	52
	Max Lat:	58
	Min Lon:	-164
	Max Lon:	-152

Instrumentation:
	No. Instruments:	42
	No. Channels:		4
	Sensor Type:		SIO LC4x4-SP 3-component geophone, hydrophone
	Sample Rate(s):		200
	Filter Bandwidth (Hz):	N/A

Data:
	Restricted Status:		Restricted
		Release date:		2018-05-01
		Contact:		Kasey Aderhold (kasey@iris.edu)
		Additional people:
			Donna Shillington, LDEO, djs@ldeo.columbia.edu
			Donna Shillington, LDEO, 
	Data format:		SEED, SEG-Y
	Data sent method:	FTP
	Data volume:		30 GB

Demobilization Information:
	Publications:		Shillington, D.J., Bécel, A., Nedimović, M.R., Kuehn, H., Webb, S.C., Abers, G.A., Keranen, K.M., Li, J., Delescluse, M. and Mattei-Salicrup, G.A., 2015. Link between plate fabric, hydration and subduction zone seismicity in Alaska. Nature Geoscience, 8(12), pp.961-964.

issues.subject: Tool to remove email addresses
issues.description:
Inge sees email addresses that get stuck in the mail queue, all we need to maintain this is a script runnable from norman, which will 

* remove the user?
* unsubscribe from topics?
* change subscriptions to non-email?
* set a flag on the user?

issues.subject: User Inbox
issues.description: Should be able to show all subscribed topics.

issues.subject: Advise user when failing to add email address
issues.description:
http://ds.iris.edu/account/email/

Add an email address already in the system. Message is "This e-mail address is already associated with another account." This should tell users to email webmaster or something. (Easy enough to do, see whether anyone actually uses it.)

issues.subject: MC Usage Metrics
issues.description:
- New users
- Subscribes
- Unsubscribes
- Messages

issues.subject: Quick post
issues.description:
User enters their name/email/etc, picks topics, enters message.
Confirmation email with link
URL creates user (if needed), sends message

issues.subject: Send reply on rejection (and hold?)
issues.description:
The user doesn't get feedback if their message is rejected automatically.  For example, if they misidentify the topics or send from a different email address.

This reply should incorporate any rejection message (#3921)

issues.subject: Security system
issues.description:
The moderation system as it stands is basically a copy of the previous Mailman version.  Each topic can:

* require owner approval for subscription requests (or automatically approve)
* require owner approval for postings by non-subscribers (or automatically reject)
* "moderate all postings"

Which is a bit of a mishmash (for instance, "moderate all postings" is really about subscriber postings, but it's not presented that way) and I don't think it tracks our needs very well.

I'd like to replace it with something that tracks our needs a bit better.


h2. Named topic types

First, I'd rather characterize each topic, and derive the rules from that.  These are the "shorthands" I've been using for building out the topics:

*Announcement*
A small number of people posting to a larger audience.
Rules: anyone can join, non-subscriber postings are moderated, moderate all postings

*Discussion*
A relatively small number of people talking back and forth.
Rules: approval required to join, non-subscriber postings are rejected, all subscribers may post freely

- Help
Users ask questions, which owners may approve and answer.  (This is basically our current knowledge base model, which I'd like to replace with Message Center.)
Rules: this actually looks just like "Announcement" right now, but I think it could be different

I think it would be much cleaner to define each topic using this shorthand, rather than 

QUESTION: Are there cases not covered here?


== Rules

I'd like to normalize the rules but I'm not sure that in itself would help with your concern:

Subscription Requests: Approve/Moderate/Reject
Non-subscriber Postings: Approve/Moderate/Reject
Subscriber Postings: Approve/Moderate/Reject

issues.subject: Add deprecation note to citation page
issues.description: bq. FDSN is moving to use DOIs for network citations. If you are looking for (or want to update) the citation information for a particular network, please check there first.

issues.subject: Topic link from thread
issues.description: Topic page is by month, so link from thread should go to the (a?) month the thread is in.

issues.subject: Stronger link between thread and topic
Fix topic selection on compose screen
issues.description: This should show all topics that the user can send to -- including topics that let non-subscribers post.  (For non-subscribers who can post, there is a link to the compose screen, but then they get there and the topic selection is blank.)

issues.subject: Announce and Help in the same list?
issues.description:
Common pattern is:

tool-announce = announcements about tool
tool-help = support for tool

Could we have a pattern for this?  Like, subscribe but only to announcement messages.

Suggests that messages themselves are tagged.  Although threads are already tagged (via topics).

issues.subject: Setting for subscriber posting
issues.description:
Basically this would just be to allow subscriber posting to be rejected.  (Because otherwise we can moderate everything.)

Maybe normalize these a bit more?

Anonymous posting: [Moderate|Reject]
Subscriber posting: [Accept|Moderate|Reject]

"Moderate everything" might then be more like "emergency moderation."  (But why? To preserve earlier settings?)

issues.subject: Topic types
issues.description:
In @create_topics@: 

            if self.topic_type in ('Discuss', 'Private',):
                instance.full_moderation = False
                instance.subscription_policy = SubscriptionPolicy.MODERATED
                instance.posting_policy = PostingPolicy.REJECTED
                instance.private = (self.topic_type == 'Private')
            else:
                instance.full_moderation = True
                instance.subscription_policy = SubscriptionPolicy.OPEN
                instance.posting_policy = PostingPolicy.REJECTED
                instance.private = False
Another might be KB: - Anonymous can post - All moderated - Anyone can subscribe Hmm, just like 'Announce' except for anonymous posting?

issues.subject: Full preview in admin console
issues.description:
Specialized processing / interdependencies make it harder, but should at the very least be able to run the whole thing through the view renderer.

Embed in iframe?

issues.subject: Caching fail
issues.description:
Cache is expiring between each hit.
(Or possibly each session, each browser should cache it for the duration of that session. Does it? Worth investigating, maybe.)

!vnets.png!

issues.subject: Deployment region predefined names
issues.description:
The deployment region choices should include things like the examples (Global, North Pacific)

Global
Pacific Ocean
Atlantic Ocean

And/or Flinn Engdahl regions?

We could even define lat/lon coordinates for each of these.

issues.subject: Celery email sending
issues.description: Break email sending into chunks and make each one a Celery task.

issues.subject: Look into Anaconda
issues.description: Anaconda has developed since the last time we looked at this, it may be ready for production use now.

issues.subject: DS side nav
issues.description: Should have an entry "Data" pointing to http://ds.iris.edu/ds/nodes/dmc/data/

issues.subject: Build site backup
issues.description:
It would be extremely handy to have a recent version of the database, scrubbed for user identities, giant media, etc. when creating a fresh install.


assigned_to: webmaster

issues.subject: Handy snippet in webservicedocs
issues.description:
"""
Non-generic views
"""
from django.http.response import FileResponse

def schema_file_view(request, schemafilename):
    """
    Return a schema file directly
    by querying the Schema model directly.

    No need for a generic view - that doesn't
    give us anything and needlessly complicated
    the file response process

    Return a simple Response object, setting the
    various headers to force a download of a file
    """
    schemafilename_object = Schema.objects.filter(
        file__contains=schemafilename
    ).first()

    if not schemafilename_object:
        raise Http404

    full_filename = schemafilename_object.file.path

    response = FileResponse(file(full_filename))
    response['X-Sendfile'] = full_filename
    response['Content-Type'] = 'application/xml'
    response['Content-Length'] = path.getsize(full_filename)
    response['Content-Disposition'] = 'attachment; filename="%s"' % path.basename(full_filename)
    return response

issues.subject: Front page nav
issues.description:
Suppose user comes to ds.iris.edu
Poor guidance
Inconsistent side tabs
- At least the linked pages should have side tabs, have to click on link in the page (not side tab) to get a page without side tab
- DS and DMC differ slightly?
Fix login link!

issues.subject: Use tags
issues.description:
See http://ds.iris.edu/ds/nodes/dmc/quality-assurance/
e.g. from Wilber

issues.subject: Provide Textile editor
issues.description:
Ex:
Knowledge Base

issues.subject: KB vs MC
issues.description: Do we need both? KB seems more curated, perhaps not for public additions.

issues.subject: Conda environment for Django project
issues.description: Don't even need a clean install.  Just start from scratch and add until it builds.

issues.subject: Data Center form goes to website without review
issues.description:
The form for entering data center information:
http://www.fdsn.org/legacy/datacenters/register/
doesn't have any review step, so information goes right to the public web page.

issues.subject: fedcatalog primary web page missing includeoverlaps in Query Usage section
issues.description:
http://service.iris.edu/irisws/fedcatalog/1/

The query usage synopsis does not list includeoverlaps as an option, even though it is listed and described further down in the doc.

issues.subject: Builder doesn't allow paste
issues.description:
Try to paste:

2010-02-27T06:30:00

into datepicker

issues.subject: Remove XML output option from mustang/noise-mode-timeseries
Help page about counts (or maybe change timeseries URL params?)
issues.description:
When the user clicks to download a waveform preview, the data is in counts.

We really need a general page about this since it comes up in other contexts, but a simple fix here might be to just add @&scale=AUTO@ to the link, this will perform the instrument correction and show a plot in Earth units.

issues.subject: DOI notification includes HTML escapes in the citation
issues.description: This is probably something to do with the conversion to text.

issues.subject: Notify PI when DOI is created
issues.description:
When a DOI is minted, the notification should go to the PI as well as internal people.

This probably entails changing the notification information, eg. removing the admin URL.

issues.subject: BREQ_FAST form generates infinite error dialogs given invalid date format
issues.description: In the inline form, enter just a date into the start and end times (eg. 2015-01-01 and 2015-10-31).  It pops up an error dialog for each one, then repeats these dialogs, apparently indefinitely.

issues.subject: Enable authentication
issues.description: The most convenient would be Unix authentication, but this may be a security hole.

issues.subject: Allow users to request institution updates
issues.description:
For instance, on the network request page, when the user selects an institution maybe we could have a little link:

> Is your institution listed incorrectly? Click here to update the information.

issues.subject: Junk Filter
issues.description:
* Nonsense (one word? non-ascii text?)
* mailer-daemon messages (common header?)

issues.subject: Clean up tags
issues.description: Tags seem useful, but there are too many and they are too liberally applied.

issues.subject: Incoming message defaults
issues.description:
Assign to sender

I have to stop relying on being the only recipient of these!

issues.subject: Make message center more tag-like
issues.description:
For instance, the footer. Shouldn't just copy listservs, it's not a listserv. 

This message posted to MC, under:
topic [topic ...]
IRIS MC etc

Subtle maybe, but should really look like a tag list rather than a list of lists. 

Also, should give immediate feedback about selecting a topic (channel?) that would be moderated. 

Wonder if this could be open sourced? Presumably others have this particular need. Would need some cleanup.

issues.subject: Wilber should be mobile friendly
issues.description: Just making all the fonts bigger would help a  lot.

issues.subject: Tags are terrible
issues.description:
Too many tags.

UI is also lousy.

Initial state:

!1! 
Should show common tags

Popup:

!2!
Show info about the tag (StackOverflow?)

issues.subject: Need better admin tools for KB
issues.description:
The KB app is hard to administer.

* Replies aren't shown in the admin console
* No way to otherwise indicate that a question has been handled

issues.subject: Fold FAQ into KB
issues.description:
We have a FAQ:
http://www.iris.edu/hq/about_iris/faqs

It's linked from our data page:
http://ds.iris.edu/ds/nodes/dmc/data/

The Data-related questions at least should be rolled into the KB app.

issues.subject: Route traffic between DMSCode and Jenkins
issues.description: Jenkins will probably run on the same machine, so we need a way to route traffic correctly.

issues.subject: Work with HQ on user login UI
KB Process
issues.description:
KB Process

* Enter question summary
* Scan for tags, show KB entries with the most tags
* Then show text area and enable submission

See mint.com help as an example

issues.subject: Easy to send email to the -owner address by mistake
issues.description:
Outgoing email comes from [list-slug]-owner@, but the address name is the same as the list itself.  This makes it easy to accidentally send email to the -owner address rather than to the list.  The name should be distinct.

Compounding this problem, email to the -owner address should bounce (unless it has a valid command, of which there are none now).  Instead it silently errors out as having no topics.

issues.subject: More notifications
issues.description:
Some may be more warranted than others.

* Notify user when their subscription has been rejected
* Welcome notice when subscription is accepted
* Notify user when message has been rejected

issues.subject: Notifications
issues.description:
Replace terrible notifications on website.

Scope/purpose

Provide a way to consistently and usefully notify the user about the status of the website.

Use cases

* Scheduled db outage
* App X isn't working
* Web services outage

Challenges

* How to specify where notice should appear?

issues.subject: Update user login
issues.description:
Point to HQ

Follow HQ UI on login

More subtle "logged in" state

Login page is awkward.  Maybe explain why they need it, really it's just an email confirmation.

issues.subject: Show requested topic from message
issues.description:
Need a way for components to take into account the current request, so 

/<topic>/<message-id>

works.

issues.subject: Allow admin to give rejection reason
Signing in with existing GMail address fails badly
issues.description: Message says to use password then connect accounts, not very helpful.  Why isn't this good enough to log into an existing account?

issues.subject: Subscription deletion should leave a record
issues.description:
Easy option = don't delete, add status

    class ModerationStatus(Choices):
        ACCEPTED = Choice()
        HELD = Choice()
        REJECTED = Choice()
        DELETED = Choice()
        CANCELLED = Choice()

Rejected = notify user, give reason
Deleted = simply drop
Cancelled = user cancelled request

Also, who performed action

issues.subject: From address on reassigned tasks
issues.description:
Without the user's address in the From field, you can't reply to them.  In fact, if they aren't in the address list somewhere, there's no way to click-email them at all.

issues.subject: Reply quoting is too aggressive
issues.description:
If responses are interleaved with the original message, the original message should be shown anyway.

The rule should be something like:

bq. If "Reply to:" - like pattern followed by everything quoted from there on (except maybe the person's own signature) then hide quote.

Also, see N1 for a nice UI for this.

issues.subject: Reassigned network shouldn't be from submitter
issues.description: It makes sense to have the initial email be from the user, but when one is reassigned it should come from the system.

issues.subject: Upgrade to Redmine 3.x
issues.description:
We are currently running Redmine 2.6, which is nearing end of life.  (Some docs said it would be supported only through 2015, although they still list 2.6.9 on their site.)

The current version is 3.2, so we are pretty far behind.  Not sure what the upgrade path would involve.

issues.subject: Station monitor page should coerce user input to all caps (or accept lowercase)
issues.description: Entering lowercase letters for network/station will fail to return results, so the page should automatically fix that.

issues.subject: Migrate remaining lists
issues.description: Umbrella issue for all non-bulkmail lists

issues.subject: Testing on dmc-dev
issues.description:
* Perl
* Celery
* Problems with compiled stuff on filesystems shared with other servers?
* PHP

issues.subject: Clean up Knowledge Base
issues.description: Huge amount of cruft in the KB, this needs a dedicated effort to clean up.

issues.subject: Wilber help area / FAQ
issues.description: There should be some more dedicated help content.  Ideally one point of integration would be with the Knowledge Base, there are a lot of duplicated questions coming from users, so a FAQ might be really helpful here.

issues.subject: Network deployment region uses operator country even if coordinates are entered
issues.description:
Example:
http://www.fdsn.org/networks/detail/1D_2010/

Going to the update page reveals that lat/lon coordinates exist, but the deployment still says "US".

issues.subject: Support links to other mailing lists
Put fedcatalog update on a cron
Bad error display when no data found
issues.description: http://www.fdsn.org/networks/detail/1B_2006/

issues.subject: Event queryset dropdown is large/confusing
issues.description:
The giant list of years makes this input huge.  Among other things, in the default state (Last 30 days) the Custom Query option isn't visible (in Firefox at least).

There must be a better way to do this.

issues.subject: Better handling of no data found
issues.description:
Two issues with the current setup:

# The exception bubbles up to the task, so it gets emailed out by Celery
# Needs a page with more explanation

issues.subject: Support silent install mode
issues.description:
From "Moore, Richard F." <rfm6@leicester.ac.uk>

bq. Would it be possible to please enable the 'Silent' install option in Allowable UI modes in InstallAnywhere for JWeed ? It would be most helpful to let it be pushed out silently.

issues.subject: Event page fails awkwardly if no stations are available
issues.description:
Example:
http://ds.iris.edu/ds/nodes/dmc/tools/event/3005157

Related problem is that the event page appears to hardcode "loc=00" into the station query, so in some cases there may be available channels but we won't see them because they're on different location codes.

Regardless, if there are no stations available the page encounters an error and aborts without a visible error, leaving the spinner graphic running.

issues.subject: Validate DOI format
issues.description:
Currently a user can enter anything as the DOI for a network.  This should be normalized and validated.

In particular, the @doi:@ prefix should be optional, and added automatically if omitted.

issues.subject: 403 error should have more useful content
issues.description: The old sac-dev list address forwards to the Message Center URL, but this list is private so if the user isn't logged in and subscribed they get a 403 error.  This page should say that this is a private topic and the user needs to be subscribed to see it.

issues.subject: Clean up DPR handling
issues.description:
Here are the (known) DPR components:

h3. Input

* http://ds.iris.edu/data/dpr_type.htm
* http://ds.iris.edu/data/dpr.phtml
* http://ds.iris.edu/data/dprr.phtml

These append to /wwwshared/dynamic/forms/qc.report.txt
The input pages actually call http://ds.iris.edu/data/FormToEmail.phtml, which sends email but also does the file append operation.

h3. Database ingestion

A daily crontab for the @rt@ user runs
@marvin2:/users/rt/DprExtractor/Dpr_Load.sh@
which reads the file into a database.
The main functionality here is in
@marvin2:/users/rt/DprExtractor/dpr-0.0.1-SNAPSHOT.jar@
which does not have source code.

h3. Access by DB

* http://ds.iris.edu/cgi-bin/mdadprview.pl (and -ppas version)
* MDA
* http://ds.iris.edu/cgi-bin/viewalldprs.pl


h3. Access by file

* http://ds.iris.edu/cgi-bin/viewdpr.pl

issues.subject: Update or delete demob form
issues.description:
http://ds.iris.edu/stations/demob.htm

It looks like recaptcha is blocked in China so something needs to be changed now.

Can we replace this with the FDSN form?

issues.subject: Returning to events page with sorted list loses sorting (but only in items)
issues.description:
# Open events page
# Sort by magnitude
# Choose an item (opening stations page)
# Go back

Sort indicator is on magnitude column, but item sorting is reverted.

issues.subject: Have option for allowing posts by non-subscribers without moderation
issues.description:
For internal lists/alises there is a somewhat common scenario of: someone not on the list sending an email to a list (e.g. Rick sending something to the wsgroup alias, Chad sending something to engine_room alias, etc.).  The current Message Center options appear to only allow an option for an Admin/Owner to moderate this, but honestly this will just be a hassle for internal lists.

An option should exist to allow posts from anyone in the "How should postings by non-subscribers be handled?" setting.

issues.subject: All messages (and links) should point to HTTPS not HTTP
issues.description:
Right now users create usernames and passwords and send over HTTP in clear text. This should be HTTPS using the new SSL certificate we have.

Thanks,
- Rob N

issues.subject: Look into GitHub integration
issues.description: If we have a GitHub repository for a project, what kind of integration is available in SeisCode?

issues.subject: Allow Apache to use Django authentication for restricted service access
issues.description:
Looks like it's actually fairly simple to set up:
https://docs.djangoproject.com/en/1.8/howto/deployment/wsgi/apache-auth/

issues.subject: Changing sliders/time window should update query type to be Custom query instead of default Past 30 Days
issues.description:
On Jul 16, 2015, at 7:02 AM, Kasey Aderhold <kasey@iris.edu> wrote:

Hello!

I just had a quick UI suggestion that kept coming up for me while using WilberIII.  Whenever I go to search for an event I usually change the dates at the sidebar to my time window, then spend a couple seconds wondering why there are no earthquakes showing up, then realize I have to go to the drop down menu to select "Custom Query" instead of "Past 30 Days".  It doesn't take long for me to remember, but I'd imagine new users probably run into this too. Perhaps if the date is changed to something beyond 30 days (or changed at all, since anything they change it to would be different than past 30 days), the drop down menu could change automatically to "Custom Query". That may be hard to implement, but I thought I'd get it out there in case it is not.

Thank you for the useful tools!

Cheers,
Kasey

issues.subject: User survey
issues.description: In preparation for the next round of development, gather feedback from users based on what we learned in the HCI class.

issues.subject: Data Services website to work under HTTPS
issues.description: Requires making all paths protocol agnostic

issues.subject: Auto-assign network request review to Gale once it is completed
issues.description: If Tim goes through the whole review process, it will be marked as completed -- at this point it should be auto-assigned to Gale for addition to Netpeople.

issues.subject: FDSN upload and parse of Excel station list and interface for download (StationXML)
issues.description:
h2. ISSUE

* The FDSN Working Group I station list is current passed around via email in an Excel spreadsheet. This is non-sustainable.
* It also cannot be queried or downloaded in any format other than Excel.
* There is no column that describes the status of station (if it is part of the GSN backbone, if it is active|inactive|proposed|blessed, etc)

h2. PROPOSED

* An additional column will be added by the Excel maintainer describing the status of the station(s)
* We initially seed an interface with the contents of the Excel spreadsheet
** All fields and columns are parsed and added to a database
* Additions to be added via a GUI (form) with fields that reflect the Excel spreadsheet
* Interface to download|export the station list to StationXML, CSV, ASCII text

h2. NOTES

* We need to ability to generate the StationXML. Currently this does not exist.
* Yazan has written a Java-based StationXML->Dataless SEED converter. We might be able to leverage that.
